attributes.action: suspend all financial aid to Sudan following the unnacceptable treatment of British teacher, Gillian Gibbons
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
On Sunday 25th November 2007, British teacher Gillian Gibbons was arrested in Khartoum.  Her "crime" was that after an exercise whereby she allowed her class of six and seven year old children to vote on what to name a teddy bear, she allowed them to choose the name Muhammad.

Following her arrest, she was subsequently charged with insulting religion, tried in a Sudanese court and sentenced to 15 days in jail.  Meanwhile, crowds of protesters marched through the streets of Khartoum demanding that the teacher be executed.

In the past 5 years, the UK has provided £326m in financial aid to Sudan and in 07/08, will provide an additional £114m in aid (Source: fco.gov.uk).

We believe that it is wholly unacceptable to continue to finance a government that allows this kind of behaviour towards British citizens for what is clearly a very innocent mistake.  As such, we are asking that the Prime Minister immediately suspend any further financial aid to the Sudanese government.
